DESCRI

description: Non Material Amendment to Planning Permission 19/01228/FUL (Redevelopment of the site to provide 297 residential units in buildings ranging from 4 to 7 storeys, with 207 sq m commercial space (A1, A2, A3, A4, B1 and D1) at ground floor, 123 car parking spaces (including car club and accessible provision); communal landscaped amenity areas, secure cycle parking, stopping up of Avenue Terrace and other associated development) to vary the wording of Condition 6 (Measures to remediate site -measures and timescale) to remove the verification requirement.
decision_conditions: Condition 6 of planning permission 19/01228/FUL which states: No development other than demolition shall commence until a report specifying the measures to be taken to remediate the site so that it is suitable for the approved development, including the timescale, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be remediated in accordance with the approved measures and timescale. On completion of the agreed remediation works, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be occupied until the verification report is approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure that the risks from land contamination is understood prior to works on site both during the construction phase and on completion and to ensure that the risks to the future users of the land and neighbouring land are minimised in accordance with the aims and objectives of the borough's Local Plan.is replaced with: No development other than demolition shall commence until a report specifying the measures to be taken to remediate the site so that it is suitable for the approved development, including the timescale, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be remediated in accordance with the approved measures and timescaleReason: To ensure that the risks from land contamination is understood prior to works on site both during the construction phase and on completion and to ensure that the risks to the future users of the land and neighbouring land are minimised in accordance with the aims and objectives of the borough's Local Plan.

The information submitted pursuant to Condition 8 (Landscaping) of planning permission 22/00597/FUL has been assessed by Officers and is considered acceptable. However, the condition is refused given that it has been submitted alongside other conditions that are not acceptable.

Application Form - you have submitted the incorrect Application Form. As the proposal is already Existing then you must complete and submit the Application Form titled: "Application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use"
